author: Staff Reporter
text:
Principal District Judge R. Poornima here on Tuesday adjourned the temple pujari suicide case till February 22 as the petitioner’s advocate informed the court that the Madras High Court reserved judgement on a petition seeking appointment of a lawyer instead of public prosecutor to handle the case.

Three accused, including O. Raja, brother of Finance Minister O. Paneerselvam, Pandi and Siva Kumar, did not appear before the court on Tuesday. Their counsel, S. Kannappan, filed a petition on behalf of them. The court admitted the petition.

Four other accused – Manimaran, Logu, Gnanam and Saravanan – appeared before the court.

The petitioner’s advocate said that petitioner, the father of the deceased, feared that the public prosecutor appointed by the government would support only the All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam functionaries.

Earlier, the petitioner had submitted a petition, demanding change of public prosecutor in the case, to Collector T.N. Hariharan, who turned down the demand. Later, he filed an affidavit in the Madras High Court in this connection, the advocate added.

Charges were framed in the case against Mr. Raja and the others on December 15, 2015.

Theni District Court had transferred the case to Dindigul District Court on November 25 last year on the direction of the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court.

S. Nagamuthu (22) of T. Kallupatti village, a Dalit, who worked as pujari in Sri Kailasanathar Hill Temple in Periyakulam had committed suicide by hanging on December 8, 2012, after he was allegedly subjected to harassment.
title: Pujari suicide case adjourned
